action.action-desc: Ms. Esty (for herself and Mr. Heck of Nevada) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to require the prompt replacement of military decorations upon the request of the recipients of the decorations or their immediate next of kin.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Proper Replacement Of Medals and Performance Tracking Act or PROMPT Act .

subsection.text: Section 1135 of title 10, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsection (b) as subsection (d); and
by inserting after subsection (a) the following new subsections:

subsection.text: When a request for the replacement of a military decoration is received under this section or section 3747, 3751, 6253, 8747, or 8751 of this title, the Secretary concerned shall ensure that—

paragraph.text: all actions to be taken with respect to the request, including verification of the service record of the recipient of the military decoration, are completed within one year; and
the replacement military decoration is mailed to the person requesting the replacement military decoration within 60 days after verification of the service record.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Defense shall submit to the congressional defense committees an annual report regarding compliance by the military departments with the performance standards imposed by subsection (b). Each report shall include—

paragraph.text: for the one-year period covered by the report—

subparagraph.text: the average number of days between receipt of a request and the date on which the replacement military decoration was mailed; and
the average number of days between verification of a service record and the date on which the replacement military decoration was mailed; and

paragraph.text: an estimate of the funds necessary for the next fiscal year to meet or exceed such performance standards.

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense shall submit to the congressional defense committees (as defined in section 101(a)(16) of title 10, United States Code) a plan to implement the amendments made by subsection (a), including an estimate of the funds necessary for fiscal year 2015 to meet or exceed the performance standards imposed by such amendments.
